definition: to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to execute (a plan)/to grasp
to bewilder/crazy about/fan/enthusiast/lost/confused
(negative prefix)/not/no
to comprehend/to apprehend/to become aware

sentences.english: Youre not the only one who can be obsessive.
sentences.chinese: 執迷不悟的人並不只有你。

sentences.english: If you suffer from pursuing, are you strong or stubborn?
sentences.chinese: 如果追求是苦，這是堅強還是執迷不悟？

sentences.english: A 36) bigot is a stone-deaf 37) orator.
sentences.chinese: 一個執迷不悟的人是個全聾的演說家。

sentences.english: If you suffer from pursuing, are you strong or perverse?
sentences.chinese: 如果追求是苦，這是堅強還是執迷不悟？

sentences.english: I dream of a fall in the wake of this stubborn.
sentences.chinese: 我在這場夢中一墮不醒執迷不悟。

definition: to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
indecisive/wavering
to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
